DataElement.preferredName: Interventions Modified Interrupted Or Not Completed Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text response that explains modifications to acts that can have preventive and/or therapeutic impact or reason acts not completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Activity or measure that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in patient or population. This is a general term encompassing medical, social, behavioral, environmental and other acts that can have preventive and/or therapeutic impact.__Modified; changed in form or character.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Modified; changed in form or character.

Concepts.definition: Modified; changed in form or character.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text response that explains why something was modified or not completed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The absence of life or state of being dead.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in apoptosis, inflammation, septic shock, and wound healing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Available in place of something else.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Available in place of something else.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.: The act or process of making something ready; also a medication made ready for administration; also an anatomic or pathologic specimen made ready and preserved for study.: gradual healing (through rest) after sickness or injury.

Concepts.definition: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The act or process of making something ready.
A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A schedule is an ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.

Concepts.definition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.: A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: alteration or modification.: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin). Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight. BSA is often an important factor in dosing.

Concepts.definition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The Doctor of Medicine degree is the first-professional postgraduate degree that requires completion of a program that meets all of the following criteria: completion of the academic requirements to begin practice in the profession; at least 2 years of college work prior to entering the program; and a total of at least 6 academic years of college work to complete a program of studies in any branch of medical science, including prior required college work plus the length of the professional program itself. The academic standard is equivalent to Ph.D. science.: The act, fact, or principle of giving advantages to some particular person, object, or course of action over others.

Concepts.definition: The Doctor of Medicine degree is the first-professional postgraduate degree that requires completion of a program that meets all of the following criteria: completion of the academic requirements to begin practice in the profession; at least 2 years of college work prior to entering the program; and a total of at least 6 academic years of college work to complete a program of studies in any branch of medical science, including prior required college work plus the length of the professional program itself. The academic standard is equivalent to Ph.D. science.
The act, fact, or principle of giving advantages to some particular person, object, or course of action over others; designated as more desirable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM definitions to reflect change in NCIt concept definition. mc 10/31/13

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

PermissibleValues.value: Inadequate to Treat Extent of Disease
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Inadequate Treat Extent Disease or Disorder

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Inadequate Treat Extent Disease or Disorder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.: Subject to a process with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition.: The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.
Subject to a process with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A problem with some technical aspect of a clinical study, usually related to an instrucment.

Concepts.definition: A problem with some technical aspect of a clinical study, usually related to an instrument.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.: Failure to follow therapeutic recommendations.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.
Failure to follow therapeutic recommendations.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.: Given.

Concepts.definition: Made less in size or amount or degree.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).
Happening again (especially at regular intervals).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Interruption; a time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: A time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
